scenario: The Charles Schwab Corporation SCHW reported first-quarter results, with revenue rising 18% year over year to $5.60 billion, beating the consensus of $5.51 billion. Net interest revenue increased 21% to $2.706 billion, while clients' daily average trades totaled 7.391 billion, up 24% year over year. Asset management and administration fees rose 14% to $1.53 billion, and trading revenue surged 11% year over year. Adjusted net income rose 37% to $2.01 billion, and adjusted EPS increased 41% to $1.04, beating the consensus of $1.01. The company repurchased 19.2 million common shares for $1.5 billion and raised its dividend per share by 8% to 27 cents. Total client assets rose 9% year over year to $9.93 trillion, and the company's active brokerage accounts reached 37.0 million. The company's core net new assets stood at $137.7 billion, and client transactional sweep cash equaled $407.8 billion at the end of March. SCHW shares are up 3.70% at $78.50 premarket.
